thread.title: "The Voice" Recap: Blake Steals an Artist from Pharrell
thread.title_full: "The Voice" Recap: Blake Steals an Artist from Pharrell

title: "The Voice" Recap: Blake Steals an Artist from Pharrell
text:
"The Voice" Recap: Blake Steals an Artist from Pharrell Posted just a moment ago 
Trae Patton/NBC (LOS ANGELES) -- It was the second night of the battle rounds on The Voice Tuesday night. Coaches Adam Levine, Blake Shelton and Pharrell Williams paired up artists to go head-to-head. No artists from Gwen Stefani's team were featured in the one-hour episode. 
The show ended with Blake stealing Ivonne Acero from Pharrell. 
We again saw appearances by mentors John Fogerty (Team Adam), Brad Paisley (Team Blake) and Missy Elliott (Team Pharrell). 
Team Adam got things started with Manny Cabo and Keith Semple, the latter of whom is originally from Northern Ireland but now lives in Chicago. They were assigned The Who classic "Baba O'Riley." Adam helped out by playing drums during the rehearsals. 
Blake, referring to the lyrics of the song, jokingly asked, "How did you know I'm wasted?" He then added that it was one of the best battles The Voice has ever seen. Adam named Keith the winner, citing his beautiful register. Manny was eliminated. 
Blake pit Chris Crump against Krista Hughes. The two tackled “When I Get Where I’m Going" by their mentor, Brad Paisley, and Dolly Parton. 
Blake said Chris is a great storyteller. He told Krista that she did a good job of adding her touch to the song. He chose Chris as the winner because he was more consistent. 
The final battle featured a pair of Team Pharrell teens: Ivonne Acero and Siahna Im. They sang a tune that is way before their time: The Supremes' "You Keep Me Hangin' On." 
Gwen confessed she didn't know who she'd pick as the winner, if she were in Pharrell's position. Adam thought both artists have some things to work on vocally. Pharrell said there's so much potential with both of them. Siahna remains on Team Pharrell, but Gwen and Blake both tried to steal Ivonne. Ivonne went with Blake. 
The battle rounds continue next Monday night on NBC.
